title: League Of Legends Punishment System NEEDS A CHANGE!
body:
After the many punishments and toxic people I have dealt with over the years I've decided to just make a new account and start a new leaf. I received my 1st chat restriction for being toxic, I fully understand that even having an argument with the players is toxic. I took my 10-game chat restriction and reformed and dealt with it. But this time, it doesn't make sense, I haven't offended a SINGLE PLAYER this entire game and I was given a 25-game chat restriction for saying I'm going to report a inting Yasuo that autolocked mid even after I called it and to make it worse, he had everyone on the team conspire with him to grief the game and everyone go midlane, and you will see that the enemy team wants to report me "Twisted Fate" because I'm playing the game correctly by going to a different lane. Which leads me to this point know where I am simply leveling up my account and I'm about to hit level 30 so I can play ranked with my favorite champion in the game, but I find it hard to play League of Legends with such a toxic community and toxic bot punishment system. The way I see it is if multiple people report you, you're going to take an offense regardless of what you do and I believe this is very unfair! I will let you read the chat for yourself and see if I've done anything toxic. I've also added a link so everyone can see exactly how the game took place. This is still allowed to be toxic on league of legends with no punishment, while I'm giving a offense for "no respect on the rift" What? Also, when I say "TF" I mean Twisted Fate.

replies.body: I know that there's more players than moderators but I believe instead of bots I really feel like for TEXT reports it should be more validated like actually run thru a human instead of an automated system because players are punished unfairly. Sort of how riot has it's ticket system when you want to dispute a issue. I don't care how long the report takes to get reviewed as long as it's reviewed fairly.

> like actually run thru a human

You need to think about that and understand that the sheer number of reports received by the system cannot feasibly be reviewed by people. Riot doesn't have enough people, time, or money to do this. Whatever number you're thinking of right now for the number of reports and/or people required, multiply that by 100,000.

You also need to understand that back when there was peer review (the Tribunal), we who participated **overwhelmingly** voted to punish. We didn't let negativity and horseshit slide just because someone else started it. **You** contributed to derailing the game as well.

You are much better off getting judged by a system that doesn't have biases. If I was reviewing these cases, I view the people who continue an argument worse than the person who started it. Machines aren't biased.

> [{quoted}](name=VindicatorOfThey,realm=EUNE,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=M2oeeylH,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2019-06-19T18:08:50.365+0000)
>
> Well...what kind of change ? 
> tell me.{{sticker:katarina-love}}

Tell everyone to use the "Mute"button if they feel it's necessary and stop banning accounts when people get upset in game. It's really that simple.

Honestly, if you're not mature enough to "mute" someone you don't like in chat, you have a lot of growing up to do.

Right now, Riot has setup a system that rewards trolls who actively troll in game and are passive aggressive/antagonistic in chat, they are rewarded when their trolling/instigating/antagonizing pays off when humans behave like normals humans and finally say something back to them in response...

It's ridiculous.

> Honestly, if you're not mature enough to "mute" someone you don't like in chat, you have a lot of growing up to do.

If you're not mature enough to not turn into a flaming ragebaby and verbally attack strangers in a video game, you have a lot of growing up to do. Nobody comes into a video game to have to deal with someone who can't control themselves, flying off the handle at every little thing that goes wrong or every perceived slight. Not only does this derail the game even further, it's against the goddamn rules.

Play by the rules or don't play.

And yet, unlike the OP, I'm not the one who got punished for raging my ass off in a video game.

If you want a lesson in maturity, here's one for you. You're not going to listen, but I'll try anyway. Maturity is knowing when to pick your battles. My skin is just fine. Want to know why? Because there's absolutely zero sense in getting all twisted up and "defending yourself" against people you're going to know for 40 minutes in a video game.

They don't know me, I don't know them, their opinions of me are 100% irrelevant. What in the shit would I be defending myself against?

I agree with this, Fortnite is arguably the most popular game right now and does not have such a system when you're playing random Squads. In fact you actually get more smiles and laughs than out of a game of League. The community is way bigger than League and I've never come across a toxic person in history in that game. I feel like this game just rewards trolls to much. I'm not saying you shouldnt be punished along with that troll if you were being toxic and giving verbal abuse back to such troll because you're the same as him, but if you're a victim of what has happened to me I feel like you deserve some sort of relief.

"Magnus is big", huh? I guess back injuries from furries heal up pretty quick. 

But seriously, don't attack those that wronged you. This can only backfire, and give you punishments. You should've just ignored him and then used a report function. Remember that you are responsible for your own behaviour, not his.
Yeah I'm just going to mute all every time I start the game. Thanks bro!

Oh, cry me a river. League is a game, not real life. Anything you do in a match will have no real impact on your wellbeing. Because of that fact, arguing and insulting each other is quite pointless, as well as distracting. This actually corresponds to what most adults learn during the course of life. More often than not, it's better to leave assholes alone and not interact with them, when they start their rants.

Riot, even if they do screw up massively in various situations, actually cares about player retention, and controlling chat is one way of doing that. Happy player brings money, you know?

You are incredibly toxic but you think your behavior is perfect, you think everyone else is toxic for reporting you, and you've had two punishments before even hitting level 30. You are the problem here, not the punishment system, but you will never understand that, which is why you will be quickly permabanned, which Riot hopes will cause you to lose interest in the game and not play anymore, freeing your potential teammates from having to deal with your misbehavior.
